comments:
I get this very reproducible error with the latest AJDT Verstion on Eclipse 3.0 
(stable):

In an AspectJ project, create a new aspect using the wizard (in a package "foo")
. Immediately close the aspect editor. Try to delete the file resource and get..
.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ltk.ui.refactoring 4 10000 Okt 14, 2004 23:31:57.250
!MESSAGE Internal Error
!STACK 1
org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException: Test3.aj [in foo [in src [in 
AspectJTest-RV]]] does not exist
	at org.eclipse.ltk.internal.ui.refactoring.UIPerformChangeOperation.
executeChange(UIPerformChangeOperation.java:80)
	at org.eclipse.ltk.core.refactoring.PerformChangeOperation.
run(PerformChangeOperation.java:191)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run(Workspace.java:1673)
	at org.eclipse.ltk.internal.ui.refactoring.WorkbenchRunnableAdapter.
run(WorkbenchRunnableAdapter.java:58)
	at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.
run(ModalContext.java:101)
!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.jdt.core 4 969 Okt 14, 2004 23:31:57.250
!MESSAGE Test3.aj [in foo [in src [in AspectJTest-RV]]] does not exist

!ENTRY org.eclipse.jdt.core 4 969 Okt 14, 2004 23:31:57.250
!MESSAGE Test3.aj [in foo [in src [in AspectJTest-RV]]] does not exist

Addition: Apperently Deletion does *not* fail if and only if the corresponding 
editor is open.

The way the two cases differ is that in the case when the .aj file is not open 
in the editor, a JavaModelException is being thrown from the call to:

ResourcesPlugin.getWorkspace().run(this, getSchedulingRule(), 
IWorkspace.AVOID_UPDATE, monitor);

in the runOperation method in 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.JavaModelOperation. In the case when the editor 
is open, no exception is thrown and the method exits cleanly. The comment in 
the code above this call is:


// Use IWorkspace.run(...) to ensure that a build will be done in autobuild 
mode.
// Note that if the tree is locked, this will throw a CoreException, but this 
is ok
// as this operation is modifying the tree (not read-only) and a CoreException 
will be thrown anyway.

I'm marking this bug as a dupe of 74426 since they both deal with the problem 
of deletign .aj files from the package explorer and quite a bit of discussion 
and investigation is recorded in 74426.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 74426 ***

traces.message: Test3.aj [in foo [in src [in  AspectJTest-RV]]] does not exist
